translation.title: The Powers of One Who has Ended Defilements

segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
9. Senior Mendicants
90. The Powers of One Who has Ended Defilements

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “kati nu kho, sāriputta, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balāni, yehi balehi samannāgato khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: “Sāriputta, how many powers does a mendicant who has ended the defilements have that qualify them to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’”

segments.pli: “Dasa, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balāni, yehi balehi samannāgato khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: “Sir, a mendicant who has ended the defilements has ten powers that qualify them to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’
What ten?

segments.pli: Idha, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno aniccato sabbe saṅkhārā yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhā honti.
segments.en: Firstly, a mendicant with defilements ended has clearly seen with right wisdom all conditions as truly impermanent.

segments.pli: Yampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno aniccato sabbe saṅkhārā yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhā honti, idampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno aṅgārakāsūpamā kāmā yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhā honti.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has clearly seen with right wisdom that sensual pleasures are truly like a pit of glowing coals.

segments.pli: Yampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno aṅgārakāsūpamā kāmā yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhā honti, idampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno vivekaninnaṃ cittaṃ hoti vivekapoṇaṃ vivekapabbhāraṃ vivekaṭṭhaṃ nekkhammābhirataṃ byantībhūtaṃ sabbaso āsavaṭṭhāniyehi dhammehi.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mind of a mendicant with defilements ended slants, slopes, and inclines to seclusion. They’re withdrawn, loving renunciation, and they’ve totally done with defiling influences.

segments.pli: Yampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno vivekaninnaṃ cittaṃ hoti vivekapoṇaṃ vivekapabbhāraṃ vivekaṭṭhaṃ nekkhammābhirataṃ byantībhūtaṃ sabbaso āsavaṭṭhāniyehi dhammehi, idampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā honti subhāvitā.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has well developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Yampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā honti subhāvitā, idampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno cattāro sammappadhānā bhāvitā honti subhāvitā … pe …
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has well developed the four right efforts. …

segments.pli: cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā honti subhāvitā … pe …
segments.en: the four bases of psychic power …
the five faculties …
the five powers …
the seven awakening factors …

segments.pli: ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvito hoti subhāvito.
segments.en: the noble eightfold path.

segments.pli: Yampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvito hoti subhāvito, idampi, bhante, khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balaṃ hoti, yaṃ balaṃ āgamma khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhante, dasa khīṇāsavassa bhikkhuno balāni, yehi balehi samannāgato khīṇāsavo bhikkhu āsavānaṃ khayaṃ paṭijānāti:
segments.en: A mendicant who has ended the defilements has these ten powers that qualify them to claim:
‘My defilements have ended.’”
